name: ANA InterContinental Tokyo

reviews.title: A Good Choice
reviews.text: Excellant location - Roppongi 10 mins walk in one direction, Akasaka 10 mins in the other. Very close to the tube station. Staff all very helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new husband and i stayed here from the 4th April for 10 nights on our honeymoon. The hotel is absolutley stunning, the lobby is beautiful. We were originally meant to be staying on the 19th floor, but when they found out we were on our honeymoon they bumped us up to the 24th floor, which i think was an upgraded room.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.text: The room was lovely and larger than i had expected from some of the reviews on here, the bathroom was quite small but wasnt a problem in the slightest. The view from our window was amazing, we could see the Tokyo tower (see my photos), i spent ages just sat in the window doing my ''Lost In Translation'' thing, just looking out over the city. The room was so clean, the in-room amenities were really good, really nice shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, plus you get toothbrushes, tooth paste, razor, brush, comb, plus the usual shower caps, sewing kits, stocked mini-bar, tea & coffee facilities etc... we also had an iron and ironing board, hair dryer, fridge, safe, slippers, Japanese style robes and dressing gowns. Nice flat screen TV, 2 english channels (i think they were CNN and BBC world news) we loved watching the wacky japanese night-time tv shows.
reviews.title: Superb Location & Hotel

reviews.text: The closest metro station was Tomeike-Sanno, which was literally a 2 minute walk away, and right on the Ginza line. The metro was so easy to use, we bought open day tickets every day which cost about 700Yen each (you can pay extra for tickets that include use of the Toei line, but we never needed to use this, you can get every where just with the metro lines).
reviews.title: My home in Tokyo

reviews.text: To get to and from Narita airport we used the Limousine Bus, which was really good, friendly staff and really clean and comfortable coaches, took about an hour and a half to get to the hotel, it cost 6000Yen each, for one way.
reviews.title: Great Hotel at Tokyo

reviews.text: I very much enjoyed my stay here. I stayed in a double room (I forgot if it was called a standard or a superior). The room was large and very comfortable. The color scheme and decor of the room was modern yet inviting and warm. The bathroom, however, could not be called luxurious - unlike the decadence to be found at the Shinjuku Park Hyatt or the Four Seasons. It was large enough and merely adequate. However, this hotel cost me $350 less per night than the other places (I booked on a Japanese travel site called Jalan).
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Manhatten Lounge on the 36th floor, in my opinion, was just as good, if not better than the bar at the NY Grill at the Park Hyatt. The color scheme and decor was stylish yet more inviting. I also chatted quite a bit with the friendly and very skilled bartenders. The view over Roppongi is colorful and lovely.
reviews.title: Comfortable, but uninspiring

reviews.text: I can't say much about the food because I didn't eat much there aside from breakfast, which was standard for a hotel of this caliber.
reviews.title: Fabulous Service
Convenient, Well Done, Great Price
reviews.text: I had to go to Tokyo for a Thursday meeting. They now run service from Hongqiao to Haneda, versus Pudong to Narita, thereby saving 1.5 hours at least of trip time in each direction. We left Wednesday night and came back Sunday mid-day.

reviews.title: Good location, great hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the ANA as 1) corporate rate was $231 USD per night, 2) my office HQ is in the Akasaka Mori ARK next door and 3) this hotel has a great location and easy access to the Tokyo Metro.

reviews.title: Excellent Value, Professional Staff, Hard Beds
reviews.text: It took about 25 minutes and 6000¥ to get to the hotel from Haneda. We were drinking at the champagne bar by 6pm where pricing is on par with the location and the city itself. Afterwards, a short walk to Fukzushi for sushi. The rooms, service, etc. are what you expect, impeccable, clean and quiet. Breakfast in the morning was the usual mix of Western and Japanese offerings and quite good and was included in my corporate rate. We also used the bar at the top of the building which has a great view to the West of Asakasa. Pricing is expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel, and you can get rates close to my corporate rate, is an outstanding value for Tokyo and Asakasa. It's well located, easy access to the metro and quiet.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

likes.liked: — Location, views from room and luxury
likes.disliked: — Had to wait for check in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is great, and very typical of fine Japanese hospitality. The staff were effiecient, always friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel, location so so

reviews.text: I found the ANA InterContinental to be pretty much just what I expected. Large and rather impersonal with good quality rooms and all the amaneties you would expect from an InterContinental hotel.
reviews.title: Pretty Much the Standard Expected

likes.disliked: — Standard rooms and tiny bathroom in need of renovation

reviews.text: Room size is rhather on the small side but everything in general was in very good condition. Maybe with the exception of the tiny bathroom that would have needed some refurbishment.
reviews.title: Have stayed in better Intercontis

likes.disliked: — Could be anywhere in the world, no care and attention paid to guests as staff are too frantic

reviews.text: What makes it an above average hotel in my opinion is
reviews.title: Stereotypical

reviews.text: a) the perfect location close to many things and
reviews.title: Very comfortable, good location

description: Location is everything in a busy city, and ANA InterContinental Tokyo has one of the best. In Ark Hills near Akasaka, Roppongi and Kasumigaseki, the hotel provides easy access to Tokyo Metro stations, government agencies and financial institutions. The Imperial Palace, Senso-ji Temple, Ginza shopping district and the Mori Art Museum are short distances away.
